intro: Dugandiodendron guatapense, commonly known as the Guatapense tree, is a species native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a deciduous tree, reaching heights of up to 20 meters, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its bark is rough and fissured, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
